title: Stock Lookup Overview
text: The Stock Lookup Overview feature provides a convenient way to view essential information about stocks for a chosen item. When you first access the overview, you'll see a search box. If you click the search button without entering any specific query, it will display all available items. To find a particular item, you can enter either its item number or a description of the part. The overview will then generate a filtered list that matches your selection. By clicking on an item from the list, you can access detailed stock information for each shop.
description:
The Stock Lookup Overview feature provides a convenient way to view essential information about stocks for a chosen item.


When you first access the overview, you'll see a search box. If you click the search button without entering any specific query, it will display all available items.


To find a particular item, you can enter either its item number or a description of the part. The overview will then generate a filtered list that matches your selection.



By clicking on an item from the list, you can access detailed stock information for each shop.

title: Stock Lookup
text: Stock Lookup Shows detailed information about an item and allows direct adjustments to be made. You must select a Shop from the list of active shops. Enter an optional search query in the Search box, this can be an item number or name. Click Lookup, a list will be displayed if more than one item matches this selection. Click on the item row to view detail. Summary Tab This screen displays the current information for this item. Adjustments Tab You can adjust stock by choosing Adjust as a Reason Code from the drop-down menu, Adjust to the correct QTY and clicking. As an example, if the value 20 is entered in the Current Stock box, after clicking adjust the value will become 20. Purchase Order Actions This tab can be used to add the selected item to an existing Purchase Order or Create a new Purchase Order. Print Label Settings This option allows the printing of barcodes to a chosen connector and label template.
description:
Stock Lookup Shows detailed information about an item and allows direct adjustments to be made.

You must select a Shop from the list of active shops.

Enter an optional search query in the Search box, this can be an item number or name.



Click Lookup, a list will be displayed if more than one item matches this selection.

Click on the item row to view detail.

Summary Tab

This screen displays the current information for this item.



Adjustments Tab

You can adjust stock by choosing Adjust as a Reason Code from the drop-down menu, Adjust to the correct QTY and clicking.  

As an example, if the value 20 is entered in the Current Stock box, after clicking adjust the value will become 20.


Purchase Order Actions

This tab can be used to add the selected item to an existing Purchase Order or Create a new Purchase Order.



Print Label Settings

This option allows the printing of barcodes to a chosen connector and label template.

title: Offline Stock
text: Offline stock is a list of stock entries that are separate from the main inventory. Offline stock is not included in On hand figures Typically this is stock which is faulty or otherwise not available for sale to customers. The offline stock list is used for viewing, managing and adding stock that has been separated from the main inventory. The reason for separating stock might be due to a sold item being returned via the POS refund, however, due to the nature of the return, this item is i.e. broken or not fit for use it cannot be available for purchase again and must be separated. Stock can also be added directly offline from the main inventory. Add to offline allows the user to add stock to the offline inventory. Search Term Allows the user to search for items within the Offline Stock. Shop Drop-down to select a shop to filter on. Vendor Drop-down to select a Vendor to filter on. Hierarchy Drop-down to select a Hierarchy to filter on. Search Search allows the user to find information on items added to the offline inventory. Leaving the filters empty and pressing search will pull everything back. The "Add To Offline" button allows the user to go through the process of adding offline stock using filters. Add to Offline Add to offline allows the user to add stock to the offline inventory. Search Term Allows the user to search for items within the Offline Stock. Shop Drop-down to select a shop to filter on. Vendor Drop-down to select a Vendor to filter on. Hierarchy Drop-down to select a Hierarchy to filter on. Search Search allows the user to find information on items added to the offline inventory. Leaving the filters empty and pressing search will pull everything back. Use the + button to add to the Quantity to be made offline. Use the – button to take away from any Quantity that has been added. Use the edit button to directly overtype a value into the Quantity field Cancels any changes that have been made to the quantities. Saves any changes that have been made to commit the offline changes.
description:
Offline stock is a list of stock entries that are separate from the main inventory. Offline stock is not included in On hand figures Typically this is stock which is faulty or otherwise not available for sale to customers. 


The offline stock list is used for viewing, managing and adding stock that has been separated from the main inventory. 


The reason for separating stock might be due to a sold item being returned via the POS refund, however, due to the nature of the return, this item is i.e. broken or not fit for use it cannot be available for purchase again and must be separated. Stock can also be added directly offline from the main inventory.



Add to offline allows the user to add stock to the offline inventory. 


Search TermAllows the user to search for items within the Offline Stock.
ShopDrop-down to select a shop to filter on.
VendorDrop-down to select a Vendor to filter on.
HierarchyDrop-down to select a Hierarchy to filter on.
SearchSearch allows the user to find information on items added to the offline inventory. Leaving the filters empty and pressing search will pull everything back.


The "Add To Offline" button allows the user to go through the process of adding offline stock using filters.



Add to OfflineAdd to offline allows the user to add stock to the offline inventory. 
Search TermAllows the user to search for items within the Offline Stock.
ShopDrop-down to select a shop to filter on.
VendorDrop-down to select a Vendor to filter on.
HierarchyDrop-down to select a Hierarchy to filter on.
SearchSearch allows the user to find information on items added to the offline inventory. Leaving the filters empty and pressing search will pull everything back.



Use the + button to add to the Quantity to be made offline.
Use the – button to take away from any Quantity that has been added.
Use the edit button to directly overtype a value into the Quantity field
Cancels any changes that have been made to the quantities.
Saves any changes that have been made to commit the offline changes.
